intro: Erysimum clavatum, commonly known as the clustered wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow or orange, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
